result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin Richard Slack

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

3:27 PM 
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CM161, 22CM385, 22CM386, and 22CM416

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person with Attorney Anne Katte.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to: 
22CM385
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Misd, Repeater >> DRI.
22CM416
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Misd, Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Bail Jumping - Misd, Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping - Misd, Repeater >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
22CM161
COUNT 1: Disorderly Conduct, Repeater >> NO CONTEST. 
22CM386
COUNT 1: Disorderly Conduct, Repeater >> NO CONTEST. 
COUNT 2: Bail Jumping - Misd, Repeater >> NO CONTEST. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 18 months probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and f/u; Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol; DNA sample and surcharge; and CC. Probation to run concurrent to any other sentences currently serving. 2 days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 3:45 p.m.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on August 30, 2022 at 03:10 pm.

10:34 AM 
Clerk Micki
INCLUDES 22CM161, 22CM385, 22CM386, and 22CM416.

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person, in custody from the MCJ, with Attorney Anne Katte.

Date and time set for a JSH. 

Atty Katte makes statement regarding these files.  Atty Katte requests JPTC/TPD.
DDA Lawrence makes statement.  No objection to scheduling JPTC/TPD. 
Scheduling with parties.

COURT strikes JT from the calendar.

Dates:
JPTC/TPD: 8/30/22 at 3:10p.m.

ADJ: 10:37a.m.
